{{Distinguish|Wiener (disambiguation)}} {{Infobox German location |Art = Stadt |Name = Weener |Wappen = Weener-Wappen.jpg |lat_deg = 53 |lat_min = 10 |lat_sec = 09 |lon_deg = 07 |lon_min = 21 |lon_sec = 23 |Lageplan = Weener in LER.svg |Bundesland = Niedersachsen |Landkreis = Leer |HÃ¶he = 5 |FlÃ¤che = 81.24 |Einwohner = 15654 |Stand = 2006-06-30 |PLZ = 26826 |Vorwahl = 04951 |Kfz = LER |GemeindeschlÃ¼ssel = 03 4 57 021 |Gliederung = 9 districts |StraÃe = OsterstraÃe 1 |Website = [http://www.weener.de/ www.weener.de] |BÃ¼rgermeister = Wilhelm Dreesmann |Partei = Independent }} '''Weener''' ({{IPA-de|ËveËnÉ}}) is a town in the district of [[Leer (district)|Leer]], in [[Lower Saxony]], [[Germany]]. It is situated near the border with the [[Netherlands]], on the river [[Ems (river)|Ems]], approx. 10 km southwest of [[Leer]], and 25 km southeast of [[Emden]]. Near Diele, there is a 380 kV-substation, where since 2009 [[HVDC BorWin1]], the first HVDC running to an offshore windpark in Germany runs.
The city was first mentioned in a monastery's records in 951.
South of Weener, there is the [[380kV-Ems-Overhead Powerline Crossing]].
==Town== ===Division of the town=== The town of Weener consists of 9 districts: * Weener * Kirchborgum * Diele * Vellage / Halte * Stapelmoor * Holthusen * Weenermoor / MÃ¶hlenwarf * St. Georgiwold * Beschotenweg
===Neighbouring communities=== In the district of [[Leer (district)|Leer]]: * [[Bunde]] * [[Leer]] * [[Jemgum]] * [[Westoverledingen]]
In the district of [[Emsland (district)|Emsland]]: * [[Papenburg]] * [[Rhede]]
==Politics== ===Mayor=== Wilhelm Dreesmann is the mayor of Weener since Nov. 1, 2006. He won 51.9% of the votes.
===Town Council=== The last election to the town council took place in 2006:
* [[Social Democratic Party of Germany|SPD]] = 53,0%, 17 seats * [[Christian Democratic Union (Germany)|CDU]] = 19,6%, 6 seats * UWG = 19,0%, 6 seats * [[GrÃ¼ne]] = 5,6%, 2 seats * [[Freie Demokratische Partei|FDP]] = 1,9%, 1 seat
Two members of the SPD group have split and form a single group in the council today.
==International relations== {{Main|List of twin towns and sister cities in Germany}}
Weener is [[town twinning|twinned]] with:= * [[Eurajoki]] in [[Finland]] * [[Les Pieux]] in [[France]]
